definition: to open (a conference)/to inaugurate

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
opening ceremony
opening speech (at a conference)
opening ceremony

sentences.english: Thaksin and his wife, Pojaman, were in Beijing until Sunday for the opening of the Olympics.
sentences.chinese: 他信夫婦在北京參加奧運開幕式，一直逗留到星期天。

sentences.english: The convention starts September 1 in St. Paul, Minnesota.
sentences.chinese: 大會定於9月1日在明尼蘇達州聖保羅市開幕。

sentences.english: The opening ceremony of the New York branch of CCB was held on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 中國建設銀行紐約分行開幕儀式在星期五舉行。

sentences.english: The school had been opened only last year by the agent to the governor-general .
sentences.chinese: 這所學校是去年由英屬領地總督的代理人主持開幕的。

sentences.english: The balance shall be paid 45 days before the opening of the trade fair.
sentences.chinese: 剩餘展位費在博覽會開幕前45天內付清。

sentences.english: The opening ceremony was moderated by Du Qinglin, Minister of Agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 開幕式由農業部部長杜青林主持。

sentences.english: What's the start date of the Asian Gamess?
sentences.chinese: 廣州亞運會的開幕日期是幾月幾日？

sentences.english: Sanmen Gorge Saige computer city when opens?
sentences.chinese: 三門峽賽格電腦城何時開幕？

sentences.english: Did you come early enough for the chairman's opening speech?
sentences.chinese: 你是早在主席致開幕詞前就來了的嗎？

sentences.english: The Opening Ceremony of the Universiade is in Nanshan District.
sentences.chinese: 大運會開幕式在南山區。

sentences.english: You don't have to wear swallowtail for the semiformal opening party.
sentences.chinese: 你不必穿燕尾服參加半正式的開幕酒會。

sentences.english: Today was the grand opening and Karla and Melanie were lost .
sentences.chinese: 今天才剛隆重開幕，卡拉和梅拉妮也在裏面迷路了。

sentences.english: Comrade Yang delivered the opening speech.
We would like take the opportunity to thanks Y. B Wong Hong Wei for his presence to officially launched the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 我們想借此機會感謝拿督王漢偉親臨及開幕此展覽會。

sentences.english: What is that like to see Yao carry the flag.
sentences.chinese: 你看到姚明在開幕式舉旗進場時感覺怎樣？

sentences.english: Traditionally, eight people carry in the flag at the Opening Ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 傳統上，在開幕典禮上會有八個人運送旗幟進入會場。

definition: to hold (a meeting, ceremony etc)
to conduct/to hold
to open a business/to open a practice/open (for business)
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
general assembly/general meeting/convention/CL:個|个[ge4],屆|届[jie4]
current/this year
meeting place/place where people gather/CL:個|个[ge4]
to enter and garrison/(fig.) to establish a presence in
conferences and exhibitions, abbr. of 會議展覽|会议展览[hui4 yi4 zhan3 lan3]
carnival (loanword)
to put on display/to exhibit/exhibition/show/CL:個|个[ge4],次[ci4]
pageant/distinguished meeting
to start using/(computing) to enable (a feature)
to offer (goods or services)/to open (for business etc)
to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)
